job_titles: Junior Consultant Business and IT Transformation
job_description:
Belangrijke grote digitale transformaties realiseren samen met de klant, met hulp van de software van SAP. Bij Deloitte.
What impact will you make?
Als Consultant Business and IT Transformation realiseer je digitale transformaties met behulp van softwareoplossingen van SAP. Als team werk je aan het verbeteren van bedrijfsprocessen van organisaties. Dit doe je door het organiseren van workshops bij de klant. Vervolgens help jij je collega’s van IT om daar door middel van SAP een oplossing voor te realiseren. Jij bent de belangrijke schakel tussen IT en Business.
Op basis van je studieachtergrond en interesse kom je in één van de vijf subteams terecht: Commerce & Sales, Finance, Supply Chain, Integrated Business Planning of Data & Analytics.
How do you do this?
in kaart brengen van bedrijfsprocessen bij (internationale) klanten en aangeven hoe het beter én makkelijker kan;
praktische oplossingen vertalen naar IT oplossingen: je draagt bij aan het ontwerpen, bouwen en uitrollen van SAP systemen en gerelateerde applicaties;
begeleiden van workshops waarbij je de klant helpt inzicht te krijgen in de huidige en gewenste situatie, waarbij een passende SAP implementatie kan worden gerealiseerd;
helpen van collega's met jouw project management, bijvoorbeeld door het opstellen van projectplannen en deadlines borgen;
een bijdrage leveren aan het opstellen en uitwerken van onze nieuwste proposities in het ERP domein, bijvoorbeeld op het gebied van Internet of Things, Big Data of Cloud Computing.
What’s in it for you?
Je deelt bij ons mee in de winst. Boven op een vast salaris.
Altijd blijven groeien. Met ons development program.
Vergoeding om je thuiswerkplek op een ergonomisch verantwoorde manier in te richten én een internetvergoeding.
Parttime (32 uur) of fulltime (40 uur) werken.
Flexibele werktijden, je deelt je eigen agenda in.
26 vakantiedagen per jaar bij een fulltime dienstverband en de mogelijkheid om extra dagen in te kopen.
Ruil 3 nationale feestdagen voor 3 niet-nationale feestdagen. Als je wilt.
Een goede mobiliteitsregeling: de keuze uit verschillende opties zoals een leaseauto, reizen met het OV, een cash budget of een combinatie daarvan.
Een laptop en iPhone. Ook voor privégebruik.
Een tijd-voor-tijdregeling. Gebruik de tijd die je op het ene moment meer maakt op momenten die er voor jou toe doen.
Een pensioenregeling waarbij je eigen bijdrage slechts 2% is. Voor later.
Mogelijkheid om deel te nemen aan de collectieve ziektekostenregeling.
Fiscaal voordelige zaken. Denk aan bedrijfsfitness, het aanschaffen van een fiets tegen bruto salaris of de mogelijkheid om een fiets te leasen.
De mogelijkheid om gebruik te maken van 55 uur oppasdienst per kalenderjaar, als jouw kind 12 jaar of jonger is.
Een maandelijks budget waarmee je keuzes kunt maken in flexibele arbeidsvoorwaarden zoals extra vakantiedagen of het financieren van een fietsplan.
Zes weken volledig betaald geboorteverlof voor traditionele huishoudens en regenbooggezinnen.
Be the true you
Natuurlijk leg je graag de verbinding tussen mensen en communiceer je effectief complexe ideeën en analyses. Bovenal durf je jezelf te zijn. De ware jij. Met je eigen sterke punten, blik op de wereld en persoonlijkheid. Verder heb jij als Junior Consultant Business and IT Transformation:
een Bedrijfskundige achtergrond (zoals Bedrijfskunde, Finance, of Supply Chain) óf een technische achtergrond (zoals Business Analytics, Data Science of Business Information Management);
interesse in IT: je gaat werken aan digitale transformaties, dus enige ervaring is mooi meegenomen;
je hoeft nog geen ervaring te hebben met SAP. Je start met een uitgebreide bootcamp en je wordt continu begeleid door ervaren collega’s;
een uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal.
(W)here
Jouw expertise deel je met zo'n 180 andere collega's in het SAP-team dat onderdeel is van Deloitte Consulting. Ons team werkt aan end-to-end bedrijfstransformaties, Finance en Supply Chain transformaties ondersteund door SAP S/4HANA, Integrated Business Planning en de nieuwste SAP innovaties. In deze transformaties staat het genereren van maximale waarde voor onze klanten binnen de gestelde tijdlijn centraal.
Binnen ons team staan innovatie, plezier en persoonlijke ontwikkeling hoog in het vaandel.
Bij Deloitte werken we hybride. We combineren werken vanuit huis, bij de klant en op kantoor zo optimaal mogelijk.
Let's make impact. Apply now!
Bij Deloitte staan we open voor alle mensen die kwaliteit en ambitie meebrengen. We zijn dan ook benieuwd wie jíj bent.

Business Consultant Process Automation
At a glance

Within the Process Automation Grid we strive to improve and digitalise the day-to-day experience of our clients and employees throughout all Client Units of ABN AMRO. We take a leading role in defining and implementing the bank strategy for hyper automation, integrating both business and technology perspectives. As Business Consultant you are part of a multi-disciplinary team (Value Proposition Team), responsible from finding the best solutions and supporting Client Units to automate their processes. As a team of consultants, we are skilled in simplifying complex content and in managing diverse stakeholders groups; regardless of whether we’re talking with content experts or senior management, we create clarity and structure that leads to tangible solutions, actions and decisions.
Your job

Your job involves a combination of activities, ranging from the definition and implementation of strategic initiatives within the hyper automation domain, to the intake of new business processes for automation; to ensure that business analysts and developers can pick processes for development. You will work closely with business and process experts across Client Units, in close collaboration with innovation teams and with the Product Owners responsible for the IT implementation.
To succeed in your role you’ll have a good understanding of what drives the client and employee experience and the IT landscape, and you are aware of the latest innovations within banking and digital. Most importantly, you are a connector, you structure and simplify complex content, and you build bridges and like to bring others together; you enjoy working with a diverse group of stakeholders from different backgrounds. Within the Grid and Team you take end-to-end responsibility for the required changes for a HUB (and the respective portfolio of end-to-end process) and/or a specific tooling domain; from ideation to implementation.
Working environment

You will be part of an international team and deal with a multitude of stakeholders from different Client Units, where every day is different. Process Automation is part of the bank wide Theme Process Digitalisation, and is an integral part of the growth strategy of the bank. We play a key role is shaping the digital tools and user experience of our clients and employees; we work close with business experts and process designers to define digital solutions, and we act as a linking pin towards development teams, ensuring expected outcomes are met and constantly assessing potential for further improvement. We experiment with concepts around process digitalisation, such as BPM workflows, rapid application development, robotics and data analytics.
Your profile

You enjoy combining think-work with execution. You understand stakeholder’s needs and can deep dive in content, structure complex topics and translate them into tangible actions. You have affinity with the fields of technology, process and program management. In your development you strive to learn and manage a broad range of topics, and to act as an informal leader. If you have experience in consulting and think your profile fits this list we are looking forward to meet you:
Higher educational background (WO); and 4 - 6 years of work experience.
Proven experience in analysing problems and processes, structuring and prioritising complex initiatives, identifying solutions/ options and presenting your advice to stakeholders in a convincing and structured manner.
You are a critical tinker and you are interested in technology. You understand the high-level picture, but you are able to get in to the details and quickly understand the capabilities of technology and their applicability in specific use cases.
The right attitude towards collaboration, exploration and getting-things-done. Hand-on mindset and the ability to act as a connector and lead by influence.
You are comfortable working in English on a daily basis.
What we offer

We want you to help us to further shape how we support our employees and deliver best value to our clients. We like to learn from your experiences and try to fit in the best practices that you learned. We offer you the opportunity to work in a multi-disciplinary and international team where there is room for growth within and outside your expertise, depending on your ambitions and drive.
A salary indication gross per year based on a 40-hour work week: Eur 65k - up to 85k all-in (incl. holiday allowance / benefit budget). Scale depends on the knowledge, experience and potential you bring (equal pay). A 36-hour work week is also possible. You can also count on a number of very good fringe benefits (including: pension, training budget, hybrid working, public transport pass).
Interested?

Does this sound like something you’d be interested in? Send us your application as soon as possible. To find out more, contact Pedro Gouveia pedro.gouveia@nl.abnamro.com. We very much look forward meeting you.
Equal opportunities for all
The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.

Working with complex, large and rich data sources, you will utilize data science technologies to build robust products using the MLOps framework. “Working with multidisciplinary teams, building end-to-end solutions for our stakeholders. Add to that a mix of smart and fun colleagues from whom I can learn a lot plus many learning opportunities, I couldn`t imagine a better place for a data scientist.”

Do you get excited about running process improvement initiatives with tangible impact and applying the process management expertise to support ING in achieving its strategy? Are you interested in setting global process standards and raise process craftmanship of the ING’s bank-wide process management community? Do you enjoy coaching your colleagues and helping them increase their knowledge and expertise? Then read on!
Organizational Context:
With its “Making the Difference” strategy, ING addresses significant changes impacting the banking industry; from changing customer expectations to FinTechs, regulatory requirements and digitalisation. ING’s future aim is to be the next generation digital bank, that provides a customer experience that is clear, convenient and consistent across borders. As part of the Global Transformation Experts, the Global Process Management (GPM) team enables execution of the “Making the Difference” strategy.
What the Global Process Management team does:
The GPM team brings value by enabling easy, uniform and digital processes. We do so by setting global standards and designs, executing and implementing process improvements and by increasing process craftmanship across ING. We are an international team of 75 people coming from different backgrounds, who are driven to make impact for ING while having lots of fun on the job. We have five GPM teams with a shared scope and backlog, of which four are based in Amsterdam. This vacancy is for the Amsterdam based teams.
Examples of recent projects:
Consumer Loans Applications: Designing a new digital process to offer a loan to a New-to-Bank customer without offering a current account.
Wholesale operations: Optimisation of organisational setup across Europe in line with the Client Services Operating model. Eliminating non value added activities, outsourcing tasks to a 3rd party.
Designing Global processes for Business Banking Lending and Mortgages as reference models bank-wide to speed up digitalisation
Eliminating the physical letters being used in back-office processes to reduce both environmental and process costs.
Your role
Core responsibility - Executing and implementing projects
You will carry out and coordinate projects across all ING countries, functions or domains in a multidisciplinary project team to improve end-to-end processes. In the position of medior process consultant, you are responsible for the progress of the project and for coaching and supporting the team to bring tangible results. You act within all layers of the organisation, from operations to management. You are a sparring partner for senior management, and you are jointly responsible for spotting new opportunities and recognising possible new projects. In executing assignments you connect to the expertise in COO network on sourcing, analytics, business controls and risks to maximise the value you can bring.
Setting global standards & design
You will be involved in developing standards for wide scale adoption. Together with expert leads and/ or other process experts across ING you will work out specific topics such as digitalisation, process leadership, operational management, where you align on standardised approach, conventions, definitions and metrics, which will be adopted in process management across all ING countries.
Increasing process craftmanship
You will contribute to increase process craftmanship across ING via:
the Process academy - providing process related trainings, coaching junior experts and
the Process community - stimulating a process management & improvement mindset throughout ING by sharing best practices, success stories and benefits of process management.
Skills needed:
We look for enthusiastic team player who combines strong analytical skills with excellent change management skills and can demonstrate following things:
Prioritisation and planning skills
Coordination and project management skills for running multiple concurrent initiatives
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, numerical insight, ability to think of new solutions (“outside of the box”); rigor in fact base / data analysis
Quickly create the right structure in problems, perform analyses and select the right root causes and solutions
Strong willingness and ambition to drive process and cultural change; ability to challenge authority and speak up
Strong interpersonal, communication and relationship management skills for interactions with management and operational staff
Leadership skills and ability to motivate staff
High level of pro-activeness and taking initiative
Strong execution capabilities and delivery of results
Perseverance and focus on impact
Can-do attitude; you are able to see ways forwards where others don’t
Background and working experience:
An excellent academic background (university master's degree)
3-5 years of relevant working experience (process design and improvement, setting global standards for processes)
Minimum 1 year of demonstrable experience in coaching colleagues, both on process improvement methods and on personal development

You & your function
As an Auditor Wholesale & Rural (Region Europe & Africa / Global Business Lines), you contribute to improving the risk and control awareness of the bank by carrying out internal audits – with particular focus on Credit Risk. But you do more than that. You advise Senior Management of the Bank and assess the most material risks, with focus on Credit Risk. You can think of corporate lending, trade commodity finance or securitised facilities provided to our corporate clients, and consider the Credit Risk related processes. Make an impact as a trainee
It all starts with data – but also with the people who know what can and may be done with it and how data can be used for the customer’s benefit.

At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.
Our CFO Consultancy business unit specializes in the delivery of assurance led consultative propositions for clients. EY is the only professional services firm with a separate business unit (“CFO consulting”) that is dedicated to the CFO agenda for both financial and non-financial clients. Our CFO consulting team consists of different competencies to enable exceptional CFO services addressing the CFO agenda items. By leveraging the Client’s data to its full potential, our FDA Team supports our clients by solving their most complex problems and producing innovative new insights.
The opportunity
We are looking for a driven and ambitious Consultant to join this exciting and fast growing area of our business. If you are someone who enjoys working with data and likes using cutting edge technology to tackle complex analytical questions, then this is the opportunity for you!
Your key responsibilities
These days the CFO’s of global firms face an increasingly complex and rapidly changing environment, in which new technological developments heavily impact business decision-making. At the same time firms are producing more data than ever before, while not exploiting the data to its fullest. As a consultant you will have a focus on the challenges that the CFO has with regards to these technologies and data related issues. You are contributing to the key topics on the CFO agenda by:
Doing project based work in a team to advice clients on major expertise topics, such as improving data-powered business processes & automation, finance transformation, automating regulatory and financial reporting, optimization and harmonization, major program transformation services, modernizing and implementing enterprise applications and finance systems, and in that way building long-lasting relationships with our clients.
Owning the topics that are on top of the CFO agenda, to contribute to a better working world.
Working in teams, at our offices, remote, as well as at the clients offices, and also working independently.
Working across multiple projects with a multi-disciplinary team for our global clients
Combining various skills, such as helping companies with their digital (finance) transformation, analyzing process and data flows for optimization, designing (interactive) dashboards to provide key new insights and presenting your work in presentations or client reports.
To qualify for the role
You are in the last phase of your study or obtained a master degree in Finance, Data Science, Quantitative Finance or related field
You are proactive, analytical, critical, result-oriented, a team player, and eager to learn new skills. You have a keen interest in (Intelligent) Automation, AI, RPA and programming and have a ‘Finance of the Future’ mindset.
You have strong interpersonal skills: written, presentation and influencing
You are fluent in English, both in verbal and in writing
Flexibility to travel in accordance with client and other job requirements both locally and internationally

Ideally you will also have
Excellent written and verbal communication in Dutch

What we look for
We are not just looking for technical accounting experience - we are interested in professionals with a creative vision and the confidence to make it happen; professionals who can integrate with and influence clients from a varying range of organizations, as part of a diverse and highly driven team. If you are looking to develop your career within a truly dynamic team, where you will make a measurable difference across some of the most prestigious businesses around, this role is for you.

What we offer
We offer a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. Our comprehensive Total Rewards package includes support for flexible working and career development. At EY, your competencies and your areas of interest will determine your future, plus we offer you:
Diverse and interesting work opportunities and assignments thanks to our innovative activities with a varied and exciting client list.
Join in the steep learning curve and improve your skillset and responsibilities.
With EY you can actively contribute to society in a sustainable way. Through pro bono projects and through participation in social projects (Social Impact Days).
